Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figure painted pottery belly amphora. Top of head of horse in panel. Purple in locks of mane and centre of eyeball; for line forming inner frame of panel; as narrow band above panel.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Possibly "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18 ?
Curator's comments: Cook in CVA British Museum p. 43 suggests room 18 as the probably findspot of this piece, but this is not supported by any surviving marks or notes on the vessel itself, in Petrie's publication, or the British Museum Register. Six fragments from Tell Dafana in the British Museum (BM GR 1888,0208.92.a, 1888,0208.92.b, 1952,0505.22, 1952,0505.23, 1888,0208.105.a, 1952,0505.24) are from belly-amphorae with panels containing the head of a bearded man or of a horse. Cook suggests that these fragments may belong to as few as two amphorae. The fragment Philadelphia E154.1, also from Tell Dafana, is from a similar amphora or from one of these amphorae (Cook CVA British Museum 8, p. 43).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B129.1.1)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 609, 1)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (pl. xxxi, 12)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 3)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.118, p.120, fig.1, p.210)
